intro: Rubus eurypetalus, commonly known as the broad-petaled blackberry, is a species of bramble native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Botanically, it belongs to the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other blackberry and raspberry species.
